reqs:
MUSC 150A Large Instrumental Ensemble - LRGE INST ENSEMB
May be repeated for credit in accordance with program requirements for B.Mus. or B.A. in Music. Open to other students by audition, with credit, as stipulated by their faculties. While every effort is made to place students in appropriate ensembles based upon audition results, those taking this course as an elective are advised to have an alternate course ready in the unlikely case where an ensemble placement is not available.
UBC Symphony Orchestra and Symphonic Wind Ensemble UNDERGRADUATES only. GRADUATE students register in MUSC 550A.
Open to both music and non-music majors. Entrance is by audition, taking place each September. Additional information regarding auditions, including downloadable excerpts for each instrument, can be found at www.music.ubc.ca/student-ensembles.html

String majors will rehearse Tuesday/Thursday only. All woodwind, brass, and percussion majors will be assigned to Symphony Orchestra (TTH 4-7:00) and/or Symphonic Wind Ensemble (MW 3-6:00) following auditions. Students may be called upon to rotate between the Symphony Orchestra and Symphonic Wind Ensemble, depending on the instrumental needs of the repertory being performed and at the discretion of the conductors. Please keep potential scheduling conflicts with all rehearsal times in mind when registering for other classes. Symphony Orchestra and Symphonic Wind Ensemble each rehearse approximately six hours per week; both groups rehearse and perform in the Chan Centre for the Performing Arts and produce five or more concerts per year, some with the UBC Choirs.

courseName: Large Instrumental Ensemble - LRGE INST ENSEMB
description: Symphony Orchestra, Symphonic Wind Ensemble, or Concert Winds. May be repeated for credit in accordance with program requirements for B.Mus. or B.A. in Music. Open to other students by audition, with credit, as stipulated by their faculties.
